intro: Guichenotia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered guichenotia, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for livestock in its native range. Guichenotia micrantha is also of interest in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
